00046 #ifndef _RTAI_ASM_PPC_SYSCALL_H
00047 #define _RTAI_ASM_PPC_SYSCALL_H
00048 
00049 #include <asm/ptrace.h>
00050 
00051 /*
00052  * Some of the following macros have been adapted from Linux's
00053  * implementation of the syscall mechanism in <asm-ppc/unistd.h>:
00054  *
00055  * The following code defines an inline syscall mechanism used by
00056  * Xenomai's real-time interfaces to invoke the skin module services
00057  * in kernel space.
00058  */
00059 
00060 /* Xenomai multiplexer syscall. */
00061 #define __xn_sys_mux    555
00062 /* Xenomai nucleus syscalls. */
00063 #define __xn_sys_attach     0   /* muxid = xnshadow_attach_skin(magic,infp) */
00064 #define __xn_sys_detach     1   /* xnshadow_detach_skin(muxid) */
00065 #define __xn_sys_sync       2   /* xnshadow_sync(&syncflag) */
00066 #define __xn_sys_migrate    3   /* switched = xnshadow_relax/harden() */
00067 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_TIMESTAMPS
00068 #define __xn_sys_timestamps 4   /* xnpod_get_timestamps(&timestamps) */
00069 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_TIMESTAMPS */
00070 
00071 #define XENOMAI_DO_SYSCALL(nr, id, op, args...)                 \
00072   ({                                                            \
00073         register unsigned long __sc_0  __asm__ ("r0");          \
00074         register unsigned long __sc_3  __asm__ ("r3");          \
00075         register unsigned long __sc_4  __asm__ ("r4");          \
00076         register unsigned long __sc_5  __asm__ ("r5");          \
00077         register unsigned long __sc_6  __asm__ ("r6");          \
00078         register unsigned long __sc_7  __asm__ ("r7");          \
00079                                                                 \
00080         LOADARGS_##nr(__xn_mux_code(id,op), args);              \
00081         __asm__ __volatile__                                    \
00082                 ("sc           \n\t"                            \
00083                  "mfcr %0      "                                \
00084                 : "=&r" (__sc_0),                               \
00085                   "=&r" (__sc_3),  "=&r" (__sc_4),              \
00086                   "=&r" (__sc_5),  "=&r" (__sc_6),              \
00087                   "=&r" (__sc_7)                                \
00088                 : ASM_INPUT_##nr                                \
00089                 : "cr0", "ctr", "memory",                       \
00090                   "r8", "r9", "r10","r11", "r12");              \
00091         (int)((__sc_0 & (1 << 28)) ? -__sc_3 : __sc_3);         \
00092   })
00093 
00094 #define LOADARGS_0(muxcode, dummy...)                           \
00095         __sc_0 = muxcode
00096 #define LOADARGS_1(muxcode, arg1)                               \
00097         LOADARGS_0(muxcode);                                    \
00098         __sc_3 = (unsigned long) (arg1)
00099 #define LOADARGS_2(muxcode, arg1, arg2)                         \
00100         LOADARGS_1(muxcode, arg1);                              \
00101         __sc_4 = (unsigned long) (arg2)
00102 #define LOADARGS_3(muxcode, arg1, arg2, arg3)                   \
00103         LOADARGS_2(muxcode, arg1, arg2);                        \
00104         __sc_5 = (unsigned long) (arg3)
00105 #define LOADARGS_4(muxcode, arg1, arg2, arg3, arg4)             \
00106         LOADARGS_3(muxcode, arg1, arg2, arg3);                  \
00107         __sc_6 = (unsigned long) (arg4)
00108 #define LOADARGS_5(muxcode, arg1, arg2, arg3, arg4, arg5)       \
00109         LOADARGS_4(muxcode, arg1, arg2, arg3, arg4);            \
00110         __sc_7 = (unsigned long) (arg5)
00111 
00112 #define ASM_INPUT_0 "0" (__sc_0)
00113 #define ASM_INPUT_1 ASM_INPUT_0, "1" (__sc_3)
00114 #define ASM_INPUT_2 ASM_INPUT_1, "2" (__sc_4)
00115 #define ASM_INPUT_3 ASM_INPUT_2, "3" (__sc_5)
00116 #define ASM_INPUT_4 ASM_INPUT_3, "4" (__sc_6)
00117 #define ASM_INPUT_5 ASM_INPUT_4, "5" (__sc_7)
00118 
00119 /* Register mapping for accessing syscall args. */
00120 
00121 #define __xn_reg_mux(regs)    ((regs)->gpr[0])
00122 #define __xn_reg_rval(regs)   ((regs)->gpr[3])
00123 #define __xn_reg_arg1(regs)   ((regs)->gpr[3])
00124 #define __xn_reg_arg2(regs)   ((regs)->gpr[4])
00125 #define __xn_reg_arg3(regs)   ((regs)->gpr[5])
00126 #define __xn_reg_arg4(regs)   ((regs)->gpr[6])
00127 #define __xn_reg_arg5(regs)   ((regs)->gpr[7])
00128 
00129 #define __xn_reg_mux_p(regs)        ((__xn_reg_mux(regs) & 0xffff) == __xn_sys_mux)
00130 #define __xn_mux_id(regs)           ((__xn_reg_mux(regs) >> 16) & 0xff)
00131 #define __xn_mux_op(regs)           ((__xn_reg_mux(regs) >> 24) & 0xff)
00132 #define __xn_mux_code(id,op)        ((op << 24)|((id << 16) & 0xff0000)|(__xn_sys_mux & 0xffff))
00133 
00134 #define XENOMAI_SYSCALL0(op)                XENOMAI_DO_SYSCALL(0,0,op)
00135 #define XENOMAI_SYSCALL1(op,a1)             XENOMAI_DO_SYSCALL(1,0,op,a1)
00136 #define XENOMAI_SYSCALL2(op,a1,a2)          XENOMAI_DO_SYSCALL(2,0,op,a1,a2)
00137 #define XENOMAI_SYSCALL3(op,a1,a2,a3)       XENOMAI_DO_SYSCALL(3,0,op,a1,a2,a3)
00138 #define XENOMAI_SYSCALL4(op,a1,a2,a3,a4)    XENOMAI_DO_SYSCALL(4,0,op,a1,a2,a3,a4)
00139 #define XENOMAI_SYSCALL5(op,a1,a2,a3,a4,a5) XENOMAI_DO_SYSCALL(5,0,op,a1,a2,a3,a4,a5)
00140 
00141 #define XENOMAI_SKINCALL0(id,op)                XENOMAI_DO_SYSCALL(0,id,op)
00142 #define XENOMAI_SKINCALL1(id,op,a1)             XENOMAI_DO_SYSCALL(1,id,op,a1)
00143 #define XENOMAI_SKINCALL2(id,op,a1,a2)          XENOMAI_DO_SYSCALL(2,id,op,a1,a2)
00144 #define XENOMAI_SKINCALL3(id,op,a1,a2,a3)       XENOMAI_DO_SYSCALL(3,id,op,a1,a2,a3)
00145 #define XENOMAI_SKINCALL4(id,op,a1,a2,a3,a4)    XENOMAI_DO_SYSCALL(4,id,op,a1,a2,a3,a4)
00146 #define XENOMAI_SKINCALL5(id,op,a1,a2,a3,a4,a5) XENOMAI_DO_SYSCALL(5,id,op,a1,a2,a3,a4,a5)

00151     unsigned long tickval;      /* Tick duration (ns) */

00153 } xnsysinfo_t;

00165 struct task_struct;
00166 
00167 #ifdef __KERNEL__
00168 
00169 #include <linux/errno.h>
00170 #include <asm/uaccess.h>
00171 
00172 #define __xn_copy_from_user(task,dstP,srcP,n)  __copy_from_user(dstP,srcP,n)
00173 #define __xn_copy_to_user(task,dstP,srcP,n)    __copy_to_user(dstP,srcP,n)
00174 #define __xn_put_user(task,src,dstP)           __put_user(src,dstP)
00175 #define __xn_get_user(task,dst,srcP)           __get_user(dst,srcP)
00176 
00177 #define __xn_range_ok(task,addr,size) \
00178         ((addr) <= (task)->thread.fs.seg \
00179          && ((size) == 0 || (size) - 1 <= (task)->thread.fs.seg - (addr)))
00180 
00181 #define __xn_access_ok(task,type,addr,size)  __xn_range_ok(task,(unsigned long)addr,size)
00182 
00183 #define XNARCH_MAX_SYSENT 255
00184 
00185 typedef struct _xnsysent {
00186 
00187     int (*svc)(struct task_struct *task,
00188                struct pt_regs *regs);
00189 
00190 /* Syscall must run into the Linux domain. */
00191 #define __xn_flag_lostage    0x1
00192 /* Syscall must run into the RTAI domain. */
00193 #define __xn_flag_histage    0x2
00194 /* Shadow syscall; caller must be mapped. */
00195 #define __xn_flag_shadow     0x4
00196 /* Context-agnostic syscall. */
00197 #define __xn_flag_anycall    0x0
00198 /* Short-hand for shadow initializing syscall. */
00199 #define __xn_flag_init       __xn_flag_lostage
00200 /* Short-hand for pure shadow syscall in RTAI space. */
00201 #define __xn_flag_regular   (__xn_flag_shadow|__xn_flag_histage)
00202 
00203     u_long flags;
00204 
00205 } xnsysent_t;
00206 
00207 extern int nkgkptd;
00208 
00209 #define xnshadow_ptd(t)    ((t)->ptd[nkgkptd])
00210 #define xnshadow_thread(t) ((xnthread_t *)xnshadow_ptd(t))
00211 
00212 /* Purposedly used inlines and not macros for the following routines
00213    so that we don't risk spurious side-effects on the value arg. */
00214 
00215 static inline void __xn_success_return(struct pt_regs *regs, int v) {
00216     __xn_reg_rval(regs) = v;
00217 }
00218 
00219 static inline void __xn_error_return(struct pt_regs *regs, int v) {
00220     __xn_reg_rval(regs) = v;
00221 }
00222 
00223 static inline void __xn_status_return(struct pt_regs *regs, int v) {
00224     __xn_reg_rval(regs) = v;
00225 }
00226 
00227 static inline int __xn_interrupted_p(struct pt_regs *regs) {
00228     return __xn_reg_rval(regs) == -EINTR;
00229 }
00230 
00231 #endif /* __KERNEL__ */
00232 
00233 #endif /* !_RTAI_ASM_PPC_SYSCALL_H */
